Summary: The 3 West Club is located across the street from Rockefeller Center and has views of St. Patrick's Cathedral and Radio City Music Hall. Reviews state that if you are looking for luxury, services, and amenities in a hotel, this is not the place for you.
This hotel is a small, European-style hotel with modern furniture and amenities, such as plasma TVs. It offers a minimal continental breakfast and is located near Restaurant Row and Times Square.

The hotel is described as luxurious with elegant decor, Frette linens, Fresh brand toiletries, and turn-down service, but some found the rooms small and furniture worn. There is a rooftop bar and a Thai restaurant.

The hotel has modern decor, often described as stylish or chic, and offers amenities such as Kiehl's or Fresh bath products, Frette linens, and iPod docking stations. Some rooms are upgraded to suites with balconies and spacious bathrooms.

This boutique hotel features comfortable beds, stylishly decorated rooms, jacuzzis, L'Occitane toiletries, and L'Occitane bath products. However, some guests found the rooms small, and experienced issues with noise and broken amenities.

Some rooms have amenities such as a guitar, record player, SMEG fridge, and flat-screen TV, and the hotel provides free breakfast, bathrobes, and upscale toiletries. Some reviewers mention loft upgrades and larger rooms, but there are also reports of small bathrooms and cramped rooms.

Some reviewers found the rooms spacious and well-equipped with comfortable beds, Aveda toiletries, and optional pillow menus; however, some guests noted the hotel was not luxurious, and that some rooms were worn. The hotel has a club room, but some guests found the breakfast expensive, and there is no bar or restaurant on-site.
This hotel is not luxury, it is a 3-4 star that has large rooms with a kitchen. There are also amenities like an exercise room and spa.

The hotel features spacious suites with kitchens, Aveda bath products, and options such as a pillow menu, tea bar, wine and cheese evenings, and tranquility kits. Some penthouse suites include balconies with city views.
The Affinia Manhattan offers suites with multiple bathrooms, Aveda toiletries, pillow menus, and luxury bedding. There are upgraded room options available, but standard rooms are known to be old.
The Affinia Shelburne offers suites with Empire State Building views, Aveda bath products, and comfortable beds. Some suites have full kitchens, balconies, and multiple bathrooms.

AKA United Nations offers spacious, modern, semi-furnished apartments with full kitchens, separate lounge areas, and complimentary broadband internet access. The hotel also provides complimentary breakfast on weekdays, access to a 24-hour gym, and fancy chocolates upon arrival.

The Algonquin Hotel is a historic, charming hotel with a celebrity following, marble accents, fine dining and a cozy atmosphere. Rooms feature bath & bodyworks products, bathrobes, and comfortable beds.
The Americana Inn is a budget-friendly hotel with small, basic rooms and shared bathrooms. It is centrally located near Times Square, but many reviewers mention noise and a lack of luxury amenities.

The Amsterdam Court Hotel receives mixed reviews, but many mention that the rooms are small, some with no view or natural light, and some have issues with noise and temperature control. The location is central, but several reviews note that the hotel is outdated and not luxurious.
This is a budget hotel with small, basic rooms and limited amenities. Some reviewers mention slow elevators, noisy plumbing, and a location far from the main attractions.
The hotel is older, with some rooms renovated, and offers suites with kitchenettes. The rooms have standard amenities, but furnishings may be worn and not luxurious.
The Beekman Tower Hotel is an Art Deco-style building with a restaurant/bar on the top floor offering city views. Some suites have balconies.

This hotel is not recommended for a luxury experience due to small rooms, thin walls, noise issues, old bathrooms, and lack of amenities; some reviewers experienced cockroaches, broken appliances, and uncourteous staff. Some deluxe rooms were available and looked as pictured on the website with comfortable beds and well-stocked bathrooms.

The Bentley Hotel features modern decor, some rooms have skyline views, and suites have amenities such as two flat-screen TVs and comfortable seating areas. The rooftop restaurant/bar offers great views.

This hotel features stylish, modern rooms with amenities such as flat-screen TVs, hardwood floors, and well-appointed bathrooms, and some rooms have heated bathroom floors. The hotel also offers suites with additional space and amenities like a microwave and refrigerator.

There is no information to suggest this hotel offers a luxury experience; reviews highlight small rooms, basic amenities, and an industrial location. Some reviews mention clean rooms and comfortable beds, but these are presented as adequate rather than luxurious.

The Best Western Hospitality House is an apartment-style hotel with spacious rooms, including full kitchens, located in midtown Manhattan. Reviews note basic furnishings and older bathrooms, with no on-site bar, restaurant, or fancy lobbies.

The hotel offers terrace rooms with views of the Brooklyn Bridge, and some rooms have jacuzzi tubs. Rooms have amenities such as flat screen TVs, mini-fridges, and comfortable bedding similar to that found in Marriotts and Sheratons.

The Blue Moon Hotel is a renovated tenement building with meticulously restored woodwork, art, and vintage decor, offering spacious rooms relative to New York City standards. Some rooms feature balconies with city views, flat-screen TVs, and well-appointed bathrooms.
This is a budget-friendly hotel with clean, spacious rooms, but it lacks luxury amenities and has a small lobby. Some reviewers found the location undesirable.

The Buckingham Hotel is located in midtown Manhattan and offers suites with kitchens, living rooms, and separate bedrooms. Some rooms have been renovated with fancy bathroom fixtures, though many furnishings are old and basic.

This hotel is not a luxury experience; reviewers mention it being a budget-friendly option, with small rooms, basic common areas, and limited services such as weekly cleaning and no breakfast. Some reviewers suggest staying at the Holiday Inn Express next door or the Marriott Marquis for a more luxurious experience.
This hotel is not recommended for travelers seeking a luxury experience. Reviews mention that it is a budget-friendly, funky hotel with small rooms, shared bathrooms, and minimal amenities.

The Carvi Hotel offers rooms with marble bathrooms, flat-screen TVs, feather pillows, and individual temperature controls. Some rooms have mini-bars, and the hotel is located near a Starbucks and other food and drink options.

The Casablanca Hotel offers luxurious amenities such as wine and cheese receptions, well-appointed rooms, and high-quality toiletries. The hotel features a second-floor lounge with a fireplace, 24/7 coffee, and a selection of snacks.

Chambers Hotel is a stylish boutique hotel with modern, minimalist decor, offering amenities such as Bumble & Bumble bath products, high thread count sheets, and a DVD library. Some reviewers mention the hotel's excellent service, luxurious feel, and convenient location near Fifth Avenue shopping.

The Chelsea Lodge is a budget-friendly guesthouse with small, clean rooms; some rooms have private showers, and guests share hallway toilets. Reviews mention a lack of luxury amenities and small rooms.

Chelsea Pines Inn is a smaller, movie-themed hotel with rooms named after film stars and decorated with movie posters; deluxe rooms are more spacious. Some rooms have whirlpool tubs, updated bathrooms, iPod docks and flat-screen TVs.

The Chelsea Savoy is a budget-friendly hotel with basic amenities like complimentary coffee and pastries, and newspapers. Rooms have mini-fridges and toiletries; however, the hotel lacks luxury amenities like room service or high-end furnishings.

The City Club Hotel offers rooms with Hermes bath products, Frette linens and robes, and the option for room service from DB Bistro Moderne. Some rooms have featured amenities like iPod docking stations, DVD players, and televisions hidden behind mirrors.
The Solita Soho has small, modern rooms with flat-screen TVs, comfortable beds, and high-end toiletries. Some reviewers mention the double-headed showers as a nice touch.
The hotel is primarily for business travelers and not necessarily family friendly or romantic. Reviews note that it is not luxurious, beautiful, or even remotely interesting.
This is a no-frills business hotel with small, clean, and modern rooms. It has a lounge with free WIFI and computer/printer access.

This hotel is not a luxury property like the Four Seasons, and is geared toward business or solo travelers, but some reviewers found it modern, clean, and efficient. One reviewer who stayed in a queen loft described it as having an upscale feel to the decor, with comfortable beds that came with eight down pillows.
This is not a lavish property and is best for travelers who are only using the hotel as a base to explore the city. Rooms are small, and some have views of garbage-strewn lots.

This is a budget hotel and does not offer a luxury experience, with some reviewers noting that the hotel is dated and in need of renovation. Breakfast is basic and served with plastic cutlery and paper plates.

The hotel offers clean, new rooms with flat-screen TVs and free WiFi, but the rooms are small and the breakfast area is basic. It is located in Chinatown, which some reviewers found chaotic and unclean.
This is a budget hotel with small rooms and a complimentary breakfast, located close to Times Square. Renovations have been made, but the hotel is not luxurious.

I am sorry, but none of the reviews suggest that this hotel offers a luxury experience. The reviews mention that the hotel is new, clean, and well-located, but they also note that the rooms can be small, the breakfast is basic, and there is only one elevator.
This hotel is budget-friendly with small rooms. It is located in a warehouse district, a 10-15 minute walk from Times Square.
This hotel is not known for luxury, but some rooms are modern and well-appointed with flat-screen TVs. Some suites include amenities like iPod docks.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, design-focused hotel with floor-to-ceiling windows offering city views, and rooms featuring comfortable beds with high-end linens. It offers amenities such as iPod docks, well-stocked mini bars, and upscale bath products, with some rooms featuring soaking tubs and rainfall showers.
This hotel is not a luxury hotel, but some reviewers mention upscale shops and restaurants in the Tribeca area. A few reviewers mention "no frills" and "basic" accomodations.

This hotel is described as a standard business hotel without much character or luxury and some reviewers mention small, dated bathrooms. While centrally located, the hotel lacks certain amenities such as a bar, pool, and views, with some rooms facing adjacent office buildings.
This hotel is not a luxury hotel, but offers luxury at discount prices with a pool, hot tub, steam room and sauna. It is located on the Upper East Side, a bit out of the city center.

The hotel offers a convenient Midtown location near attractions like Times Square and Grand Central Station. Some rooms feature granite countertops and comfortable beds, though many guests describe the rooms as small.

This hotel is not a luxury experience and lacks a fancy lobby; it is a typical Courtyard Marriott with clean rooms. It does offer a fitness center, and customers can get a limo to the airport for a fee.

The Crosby Street Hotel is praised for its luxurious atmosphere, attention to detail, and personalized service. It features uniquely designed rooms, spacious suites, high-quality amenities like Miller Harris toiletries, and dining options including a bar with an extensive wine selection.
The Crowne Plaza Times Square offers concierge rooms and suites with access to a private lounge, and room service. Some rooms have luxury bedding, plasma TVs, and spa-like bathrooms.
There are no indicators of a luxury experience. Reviews note that it is a budget hotel with small, basic rooms.

This hotel offers spacious suites, but several reviews mention that it is not a luxury experience with the quality of the rooms not matching the price. While some suites have great views of Times Square, the lobby and hallways can be crowded and noisy.

The hotel offers modern, clean rooms and amenities, with some rooms featuring views of the Empire State Building. Some reviewers found the rooms small, and note that the hotel is located in an area that is not particularly luxurious.

The Doubletree Metropolitan is described as having a funky, modern decor, a clean and comfortable room, and a recently renovated lobby, but many reviewers mention issues such as small bathrooms, peeling wallpaper, noise, and small rooms. The hotel was described as "Not up to Hilton standards" and "This hotel is old and run down" by different reviewers.

This hotel offers stylish rooms with L'Occitane toiletries, Bose radios, and the option of a massage at the spa; the rooftop bar offers great city views. Some reviewers found that the rooms were small, and the hotel can get noisy due to its location and the rooftop bar.

The Duane Street Hotel is an upscale boutique hotel in the Tribeca area with high-end bath products, comfortable beds, and turndown service with desserts. Some rooms feature rainfall-style shower heads and sound-proofed windows, and the hotel offers access to a nearby fitness club.

The Dylan Hotel aims for a modern, boutique style with spacious rooms, high ceilings, and marble bathrooms, with some rooms featuring amenities like iPod docking stations and high-tech equipment. Several reviewers felt it had lost its shine or fallen short of a luxury experience due to small bathrooms, worn furnishings, and inconsistent service.
This hotel is noted to have spacious rooms and suites, some with kitchens, but the decor is often described as dated. Reviewers note that the hotel is clean, but not luxurious.
This is an Econo Lodge with small, clean rooms and a free continental breakfast. Reviews mention the rooms are small, the elevator is slow, and there can be street noise.

The hotel offers spacious suites with Hudson River views, though new construction may obstruct some views. Some rooms include jetted tubs, and it offers premium amenities like free breakfast and evening receptions.

The Empire Hotel has a trendy, hip, and urban décor, with rich dark browns and candles throughout; the lobby has comfy seating areas and a bar, and the rooms have mini-bars and bathrobes. The rooftop bar offers great views of the city, and there are two restaurants attached to the hotel; the location is near Central Park and Lincoln Center.

The Envoy Club offers spacious apartments with fully-equipped kitchens, with some reviewers noting the availability of high-end linens and comfortable beds. Some reviewers mention issues with dated carpets and worn furniture, while others praise the cleanliness and recent renovations.

The hotel has a boutique feel with modern, large rooms that include amenities such as plasma TVs, fully equipped kitchens, and stylish furniture. Some rooms are very spacious with leather couches, and free internet access is available.

The Excelsior Hotel is described as an elegant, old-fashioned hotel with suites available, some offering park views and high-quality bedding. A restaurant is available, although some found it expensive and the adjoining bar is independently owned.

The hotel is new, with rooms that are small but clean and well-appointed, featuring comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and modern bathrooms with glass-doored showers. While some reviewers mention penthouse suites with city views, the hotel generally offers limited luxury amenities such as no room service, a basic complimentary breakfast, and a small gym.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central offers luxurious rooms with comfortable beds, Italian marble bathrooms, and amenities like plush robes and high-end bath products; some suites include features like Waterford crystal chandeliers, fireplaces, and soaking tubs with televisions. The hotel is often described as having a charming and intimate feel, reminiscent of an Irish home away from home.

The hotel has suites with Italian marble bathrooms and offers luxury, charm, and Irish hospitality. Some rooms include amenities such as flat-screen TVs, iPod docking stations, and high-end toiletries.

The Flatotel offers large rooms and suites, some renovated with modern decor, and jacuzzi tubs in some bathrooms; however, some rooms are unrenovated with dated furniture. Some reviewers mention a lack of luxury amenities and inconsistent service.
This hotel is not a luxury hotel, but it is well appointed with comfortable beds and reading lights. There are renovated rooms/floors available and "Starwood Preferred Guest floors".

This hotel is described as a new, modern, and clean hotel with small but well-appointed rooms, although some found the beds uncomfortable. Some reviews note that the hotel lacks luxury amenities such as a lounge, and the gym is minimal.
The hotel offers comfortable beds and suites on the top floor for platinum members. Some reviewers found the rooms small and lacking counter space in the bathroom.

The Four Seasons New York offers spacious rooms, luxurious marble bathrooms with fast-filling tubs, and Bulgari bath products. Concierge services are impeccable, and guests can be chauffeured in a Rolls Royce Phantom or Maybach.

Gild Hall is a stylish boutique hotel with comfortable rooms featuring high-quality linens, Kiehl's toiletries, and modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and iPod docking stations. Some rooms offer luxurious features such as Frette sheets, spacious layouts, and well-appointed bathrooms, with certain suites including two big wall flatscreens with HD.

The Gramercy Park Hotel offers stylish rooms with unique decor, Frette bathrobes, and minibars with crystal glasses; some suites have iPod docking stations. Guests have access to the Rose Bar, Jade Bar, and a rooftop lounge with a garden.

The Grand Hyatt boasts a grand lobby and some reviewers mention luxurious details such as quality linens and spacious rooms, but some found the rooms dated and not up to 4-star standards. The hotel offers options like executive suites, VIP suites, and access to the Regency Club with complimentary breakfast, snacks, and a dedicated concierge, but some found issues with room service prices and extra charges for amenities.

The Greenwich Hotel offers luxurious rooms with unique decor, Duxiana mattresses, and marble bathrooms with Red Flower toiletries. Guests can enjoy a spa with high-priced treatments, a warm Japanese-style pool, a gym, and a courtyard.

This hotel is a newer property with clean, modern rooms, but some reviewers note that the rooms are small, even by NYC standards. It is located close to shopping and attractions with a free breakfast, 24/7 beverage station and a fitness center.
I am sorry, but there is no mention of luxury experiences at this hotel in the reviews you provided. Most guests cite the location and staff friendliness as highlights.
This Hampton Inn offers standard amenities such as a free breakfast buffet with hot and cold items and a fitness room. Some rooms have views of the city skyline.

This hotel is described as having a modern, upscale decor with exposed beams in the lobby and a greenhouse, although some found the rooms small and lacking in amenities such as a minibar or robe. The hotel is near SoHo shopping and has comfortable beds, but some found the rooms noisy.
The hotel is described as small, with rooms that are clean and nicely appointed but compact. Some rooms have nice views, and the hotel is located near Times Square and Broadway.
The hotel is described as a budget hotel that is clean, modern, and well-presented, but small. It is located near the South Street Seaport and Brooklyn Bridge.

The Helmsley Middletowne is an older hotel with large rooms, some of which are suites with kitchenettes, though the décor is often described as dated and worn. While some reviewers found the hotel clean and comfortable, others cited issues with cleanliness, smells, and maintenance, and recommend that this hotel is not suitable for those seeking luxury.

The hotel offers suites on the 37th and 38th floors with a private check-in, complimentary breakfast, a cocktail reception, a gym, and a business center. Some rooms include rainfall shower heads and side jets.
This hotel does not offer a luxury experience. It is clean, modern, and has comfortable beds.

This Hilton Garden Inn is a new, modern hotel with small rooms, Neutrogena toiletries, and comfortable beds that have adjustable firmness. Some reviewers compared it to a boutique hotel and said it could compete with luxury places.

The NewYork HILTON GARDEN INN TIMES SQUARE has a fireplace and features red, brown and yellow decor, with black and white portraits of New York City displayed throughout, and offers Neutrogena toiletries. Some reviewers mentioned booking an evolution room, which was great, big and comfy, really nice with a great view.
The hotel is new with contemporary furnishings and marble bathrooms, but rooms are small. Some rooms have jacuzzi tubs.

Some reviewers mention recently renovated rooms with flat-screen TVs, Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries, and marble bathrooms; however, some rooms are small, and others are in need of renovation. There are bars, restaurants, and concierge services available, but these receive mixed reviews and can be pricey.

The Hilton Times Square offers spacious, clean rooms with comfortable beds and high-floor views, including Empire State Building views from some rooms. Room service is available, though some found it expensive, and some rooms offer a mini-bar with items charged if removed.

This Holiday Inn Express is not recommended for a luxury experience, as reviews mention small rooms and a basic continental breakfast. However, the rooms are modern and clean, and the hotel is located near 5th Avenue shopping.
The hotel is new as of 2009 and the rooms are small, clean, and modern. There are free computers with internet in the lobby.
This hotel is a Holiday Inn Express, which is known for value, not luxury, but some reviewers note upscale furnishings and bedding. There is also a whirlpool tub available in some rooms.

This Holiday Inn is not a luxury hotel, with small rooms and old equipment, so it may not be suitable for those seeking a luxury experience. Some guests found the hotel to be outdated, and generally not up to Holiday Inn's usual standard.

This Holiday Inn is a budget-friendly option with a rooftop pool (seasonal), but many reviewers note that the hotel is dated and in need of renovation. Some reviews mention small bathrooms, thin walls, and rude staff.
This hotel is not recommended for a luxury experience. Reviews mention that the rooms are small, and there are few amenities.
This hotel is a budget-friendly option with small, basic rooms, and shared bathrooms. Reviews mention quirky decor, old-fashioned charm, and a location in a quiet, residential neighborhood.

This is a budget hotel with small rooms, no frills, and shared bathrooms, although some rooms have private bathrooms for an additional fee. There is no restaurant, bar, or internet, and the elevator is small and slow.
This hotel is known for small, but modern and clean rooms with comfortable beds and Aveda bath products. It is located on 5th Avenue, near the Empire State Building and has a Starbucks attached.

Hotel 41 offers immaculately clean penthouse suites with terraces and double bathrooms with showers and baths. Some rooms include plasma TVs, Aveda bath products, and valet parking for $32 for 24 hrs.

Hotel 99 offered modern, well-decorated rooms with large LCD TVs and bathrooms with glass-door showers and bathtubs. Some rooms featured intricate stonework, but the hotel was undergoing renovations during the reviews, with the elevator not operational and some floors still under construction.

This hotel has spacious rooms and suites, some with king-sized beds and walk-in closets, and provides amenities such as upgraded linens, marble bathrooms, and modern furnishings after recent renovations. The property includes suites with kitchenettes, but it is an older-style hotel.

The Hotel Chandler is a boutique hotel praised for its luxurious linens, Aveda toiletries, and comfortable beds. Some suites include sitting areas with two flat-screen TVs, and the hotel offers turn-down service with chocolates.
Hotel Deauville is a budget hotel with basic amenities and small rooms. It has an old-fashioned elevator operated by staff, and some rooms have purple bathrooms.
Bulgari toiletries are provided. The rooms have a modern design, flat-screen TVs, and comfortable beds with nice bedding.

Hotel Elysee is a small, elegant boutique hotel with European ambiance, offering complimentary breakfast, afternoon wine and cheese, and access to a nearby sports center. Some suites feature fireplaces, sunrooms, and upgraded amenities like Prosecco and chocolates upon arrival.

This modern, luxury hotel is located in the Meatpacking District near restaurants, shops, and nightlife. It offers a rooftop pool and bar, as well as spacious rooms with comfortable beds, and quality service.

Hotel Giraffe offers well-appointed rooms with amenities like flat-screen TVs, iPod docking stations, and upscale bath products, with turn-down service and luxurious bedding; some suites feature balconies and separate living areas. It also has complimentary wine and cheese in the afternoon.

This hotel is a budget-friendly option with small, basic rooms that are generally clean, but not luxurious. Some reviewers noted worn bedding and older decor, while others found the rooms recently renovated.

The hotel offers Aveda toiletries, a modern minimalist design, and a restaurant (Blu) with high-quality food; however, some rooms lack amenities such as a coffee maker, luggage rack, and closet. Some reviewers note small room sizes and issues with service inconsistency.
Hotel Mela offers rooms with luxurious bedding and modern decor, including H2O spa products. Some reviewers have mentioned upgrading to suites with more space and amenities.
I am sorry, but there is no indication of luxury experiences available at this hotel in the text. The reviews mention a gym, and a rooftop bar.

Hotel Newton is a budget-friendly hotel located on the Upper West Side near the subway, with clean rooms and helpful staff, but it lacks luxury amenities. Rooms can be small, and some have shared bathrooms.

The Hotel on Rivington offers rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows offering great views, Tempur-pedic beds, Frette linens, and well-stocked minibars. Some rooms have steam showers and Japanese soaking tubs.
The hotel has upscale bathroom amenities, and some rooms have granite counters and plush bedding. Rooms have a flat-screen TV, and high-speed wireless is available.

This is a budget hotel with small, basic rooms and minimal amenities, though some rooms have been renovated; it is praised for its unbeatable location near Times Square. Reviews mention small, thin towels, small TVs, no coffee makers, no ice machines, and a lack of temperature control in rooms.

This is a budget hotel with small, basic rooms, though some rooms have been renovated with marble bathrooms and flat-screen TVs. The hotel offers a basic continental breakfast and has only one slow elevator for all floors.
Some reviewers mention suites with separate sitting areas, comfortable beds with high-quality linens, and Aveda bath products. The hotel is described as having a quaint, old-world decor.

Some reviewers enjoyed the modern design and bar scene, but most agree that the rooms are small and there are often issues with cleanliness and noise. There are few luxury amenities, such as no minibar and extra charges for Wi-Fi.

Ink48 offers spacious rooms, some with Hudson River or city views, and large bathrooms with soaking tubs and L'Occitane bath products. Some suites have floor-to-ceiling windows and are stylishly furnished, with the hotel planning a rooftop lounge with a hot tub.

The Inn New York City is a boutique hotel on the Upper West Side with uniquely decorated suites featuring amenities like Jacuzzi tubs, saunas, fireplaces, and fully stocked kitchens with fresh pastries and high-end toiletries. Some suites also have private terraces and baby grand pianos.

The Intercontinental Barclay has a grand lobby, excellent location in midtown Manhattan, and some rooms have an iPod docking station. Some reviewers mention comfortable beds and a romantic atmosphere.

The Jumeirah Essex House is a luxury hotel with a recent $70 million renovation, an art deco lobby, and a location directly across from Central Park. Rooms have comfortable beds, high-end toiletries, and technology such as plasma TVs and touchscreen telephones.

The Kitano Hotel offers spacious and clean rooms, luxurious bathrooms, and is known as an oasis of calm with soundproof windows, high-quality bedding and towels, and Shiseido toiletries. Some reviewers specifically mentioned enjoying a luxury experience that was quiet, comfortable, and in a convenient location near Grand Central Station.
This hotel is a budget-friendly option with small rooms and basic amenities. The hotel is old and could use some updating.

Lafayette House is a boutique hotel in a historic 1848 building with uniquely decorated rooms featuring antique furniture, fireplaces, sitting areas, and kitchenettes. Some rooms have terraces, large bathrooms with deep tubs, and access to a courtyard garden.

This modern, centrally-located Midtown hotel features spacious rooms, some with Central Park views from higher floors, and offers amenities like a rooftop pool, gym, and restaurants including Norma's. Some suites have a den with a sofa bed and a large walk-in shower.

The Library Hotel offers a luxury boutique experience with high-quality amenities including a rooftop bar, a 24-hour reading room, and evening wine and cheese. It is often described as offering a tranquil and elegant atmosphere and is highly rated for cleanliness, comfort, and the quality of its service.

The Loews Regency on Park Avenue offers spacious rooms with comfortable bedding and a prime location near Central Park and upscale shopping, though some find the decor dated. Some suites feature kitchenettes, and bathrooms may include TVs and bidets, but some guests have noted small bathrooms and maintenance issues.

The Lowell is a small, intimate, and elegant hotel on the Upper East Side, offering spacious suites with kitchens and luxurious bathrooms with Bulgari toiletries and TVs. It provides a quiet, private, and luxurious experience with attentive staff and amenities like a working fireplace and afternoon tea in the Pembrooke Room.

The Mandarin Oriental New York offers luxury rooms with high-end decor, spacious bathrooms, and stunning city and Central Park views from its upper-floor location. Amenities include a spa, a pool, a gym, and fine dining in Asiate.

The Milford Plaza is an older, budget-friendly hotel with small, dated rooms and bathrooms that are often described as musty or dirty. It is undergoing renovations, but these are not yet reflected in the room quality.

The Millenium Hilton offers modern, sleek, spacious rooms with amenities like plasma TVs, Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries, and options for high-floor corner suites with river and city views. Some reviewers cite luxurious beds and linens, as well as an indoor pool and fitness center.

While the Millennium Broadway boasts a fantastic location in Times Square and helpful staff, reviews suggest the rooms are often small, dated, and lacking in luxury amenities, with some guests reporting issues with cleanliness and basic supplies. Some reviewers mentioned upgraded rooms, but the overall consensus is that the hotel does not consistently deliver a 4-star experience.

This luxury hotel is known for its great views of NYC from its large, clean rooms, and features workout facilities with stunning views and a nice pool. It's located on the east side, a few blocks from Grand Central, and offers a quiet respite from the tourist mobs of midtown.

The Moderne is a small, older, no-frills hotel with rooms that are described as simple, clean, and sometimes small or dark. It has minimal amenities, with no restaurant or room service, and offers free coffee and tea service on the 2nd floor.

Morgans Hotel offers stylish rooms with comfortable beds and iPod docks, with some rooms even offering views of the Empire State Building; suites are available, with some including separate living rooms and bathrooms with both tubs and showers. The hotel also provides complimentary breakfast at Asia de Cuba, a living room with free tea and coffee, and access to a nearby gym.

This hotel is not a luxury experience, but a clean and comfortable place to stay with spacious rooms that include a kitchenette. It's located in a convenient area, close to Grand Central Station and other attractions.
This is a budget-friendly hotel with small, basic rooms and no elevator. Some rooms have been recently remodeled with updated bathrooms.

The hotel features comfortable beds, excellent room service, a Starbucks, and a Roy's restaurant with Hawaiian-fusion cuisine. Some reviewers noted a corner room with a view of the Hudson River and Statue of Liberty.

The Marriott East Side has concierge level service with food, drinks, and desserts; some rooms have marble bathrooms and jacuzzi tubs. While some found it dated, others report renovations and a comfortable experience.

The Marriott Marquis is a large, modern hotel with restaurants, lounges, and shops, including a revolving restaurant with city views. Some reviewers mention astonishing views, magnificent decor, luxurious rooms, and access to a concierge lounge.

The New York Palace is a luxurious hotel in Midtown Manhattan that features spacious rooms, turn-down service, and upscale restaurants. Executive level rooms provide access to a lounge with complimentary meals and drinks.

The Night Hotel has Molton Brown toiletries, Frette towels, Bose sound systems, and an iPod dock. Some reviewers found it to be a luxury experience, while others found it to be overpriced and not worth the money.

The hotel is described as clean with a beautiful lobby but the rooms are frequently described as tired and in need of renovation and some rooms are small. Some reviewers mention that the hotel has amenities such as a gym, free internet access, a bar, and a restaurant, but these may be expensive.

The Off Soho Suites offers apartment-style suites with kitchens, but some reviewers found the furniture and bedding uncomfortable and noted the lack of amenities and daily cleaning service. The surrounding area is described as industrial and noisy, and some rooms may have issues with cigarette smoke or noise from a nearby restaurant.

The Omni Berkshire Place is a luxury hotel located in Midtown Manhattan, close to shopping on 5th Avenue and other attractions, with marble bathrooms, luxury amenities, and Select Guest perks like complimentary morning beverages. Suites are available and some rooms offer whirlpool tubs and separate bath and shower.

The hotel has panoramic deluxe rooms, a penthouse loft, and mini-suites, some with balconies and views of the Hudson River and Central Park. Some reviewers describe it as a luxury, upscale boutique establishment, but others note it is more basic and spartan and that rooms show signs of wear and tear.
This is a budget hotel with small rooms and shared bathrooms, though some rooms have private bathrooms and have been renovated. The hotel is in an old building with thin walls and a slow elevator.

The Park Central Hotel offers impeccable presentation and a nice lobby, but some reviewers mention dated rooms and occasional issues with cleanliness. Other potential drawbacks include expensive food, small rooms, and extra charges for services like luggage storage.

This is a smaller boutique hotel that offers complimentary robes and upgraded toiletries. There is a bar/bistro, called The Black Duck, with a good wine selection and comfortable chairs and tables that are open air to the street, weather permitting, and offers live jazz on weekends.

The Peninsula is a luxury hotel located on 5th Avenue, known for its spacious rooms, well-appointed bathrooms with TVs, a rooftop bar with city views, and a pool and spa. While some reviewers noted that the hotel may be expensive and some areas may need updating, the service is generally regarded as attentive and professional.

The Phillips Club offers stylish, modern suites with kitchens, Bose sound systems, and access to a nearby Reebok Club. Some suites have impressive bathroom facilities and views, with services like in-room massage and show ticket arrangements available.

The Plaza Athenee is a luxury boutique hotel on the Upper East Side with spacious, elegantly furnished rooms and attentive staff. It features a cozy bar, fine dining, and is located near Central Park and upscale shopping on Madison Avenue.

This hotel is not a luxury hotel, it has small rooms, with small bathrooms, and offers an executive suite upgrade. Some rooms have a sleep number bed, or come with access to the Martinique Club which provides complimentary breakfast and cocktails.
There is a gym with limited equipment.

This hotel is not a luxury hotel, but some reviewers were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the rooms and lobby and found it to be great value for the price. Some reviewers mention features like LCD TVs, iPod docks, and updated bathrooms, but also note that the rooms can be small.

Hotel 57 is a boutique hotel with modern decor, renovated rooms, Aveda bath products, and sky loft suites that feature Lacava fixtures and private terraces. It has a restaurant and bar, and a concierge lounge, but some found the restaurant pricey and the concierge service slow.

The Renaissance New York Times Square is a modern, recently renovated boutique hotel with well-appointed rooms and comfortable beds. Some rooms offer great views of Times Square, and the hotel provides a reserved section for the New Year's Eve ball drop.

This hotel offers spacious rooms with kitchenettes, comfortable beds with high-quality pillows and linens, and upgraded amenities. Some reviewers mentioned spectacular views from higher floors, a bar on the 3rd floor, and valet parking for $54.

This Ritz-Carlton offers harbor view rooms with telescopes, spacious rooms with comfortable beds, and a concierge level with food and drink presentations. Some reviewers found the level of service not up to the chain's standards, but the location is quiet, near the water, and away from the busier areas of Manhattan.

This hotel is not the place to stay for a ritzy lobby and butlers, and does not offer lots of service, a lobby bar, or a restaurant. Some reviewers noted that if you want large terraces, visit the Marriot for a billion dollars.

The Roger Smith Hotel is centrally located near Grand Central Station and offers spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes. Some suites have been upgraded and feature multiple TVs, and the hotel has a restaurant and bar, Lily's.

The Roger Williams is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with comfortable beds, Aveda bath products, and a fitness center; penthouse rooms with terraces offer Empire State Building views. Guests can enjoy European-style breakfast and a convenient midtown location.

This trendy boutique hotel offers a pool, sauna, steam room, DirecTV, iPod docking station, and spacious showers; breakfast is included and features lattes. Some rooms have see-through shower curtains or no doors between the shower and the room, and the pool sometimes hosts loud parties.

The Royalton Hotel offers a luxurious and stylish experience with amenities like fireplaces, soaking tubs, and rain showers. It is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan, close to attractions like Times Square and 5th Avenue.

This hotel is an older property with some dated decor, it is not for those seeking the finer aspects of hotel luxury. It offers clean, spacious rooms, but lacks on-site dining and has limited amenities such as no fitness center or free wifi.

The San Carlos Hotel offers spacious suites with kitchenettes, luxurious bedding, Aveda bath products, and amenities such as a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Some reviewers mention the availability of robes, upscale furnishings, and comfortable seating.

The Seafarers International House offers basic, clean accommodation with options for private or shared bathrooms. It has amenities like free internet in the lobby, vending machines, and laundry facilities, but lacks luxury amenities.

This hotel is not generally considered luxurious, and many guests have noted worn or outdated rooms; however, some rooms are renovated, some suites are available, and club-level rooms offer complimentary breakfasts and evening snacks. The hotel has a well-equipped fitness center, though there is a fee to use it.

The Skyline Hotel is a budget-friendly option, with some rooms recently renovated, but many reviewers describe the decor as old-fashioned. The hotel offers amenities like an indoor pool, but some found it unclean or with limited hours.

The Smyth Tribeca is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with spacious rooms, comfortable beds with SFERRA linens, Kiehl's bath products, and large bathrooms. Select rooms include features such as soaking tubs, rainfall showerheads, and multiple flat-screen TVs.

The Sofitel New York is a luxury hotel with chic, art-deco style, marble bathrooms, and comfortable beds, offering amenities such as B﻿ose sound systems, HD TVs, L'Occitane toiletries, and, in some rooms, views of the Chrysler and Empire State buildings. The hotel is centrally located in midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square and 5th Avenue, and offers services such as concierge, multilingual staff, and room service.

The Soho Grand Hotel offers luxurious bedding with Frette linens, Malin + Goetz toiletries, a Bose sound system, and the option for a complimentary goldfish. Some rooms offer city views and the hotel has a bar and 24-hour gym.

Soho House New York offers spacious, well-appointed rooms with amenities like steam room showers, Cowshed spa products, and maxi bars, and also features a rooftop pool and spa. Some reviewers noted the hotel's trendy atmosphere, with access to a private club, events, and a rooftop bar.

The hotel has a chic and modern lobby with unique decor, including fish tanks, and offers amenities like Bose sound systems and L'Occitane products in some rooms. Some reviewers felt the hotel experience didn't match its advertised luxury.

The Alex Hotel offers suites with kitchens, high-end toiletries, and comfortable beds, with some rooms featuring Chrysler Building views. Some reviewers noted issues with worn furniture, small bathrooms, and occasional noise.

Executive rooms are recently renovated with marble bathrooms, Kohler fixtures, and soaking tubs, but the standard rooms are older and more basic; rooms include a kitchenette with a microwave and refrigerator. The Belvedere is described as a decent 3-star or "boutique" hotel that is clean and well-maintained, but some guests have noted issues with small bathrooms and outdated decor in non-executive rooms.
The Benjamin offers a "pillow menu" with various pillow types and a spa with massage services. Some suites include kitchenettes with full-size refrigerators and microwaves.

The Blakely Hotel features spacious suites with amenities like marble bathrooms, jacuzzi tubs, Penhaligon toiletries, and kitchenettes. Some rooms offer high-end features such as flat-screen TVs, soaking tubs and comfortable beds with high quality linens.

The Bowery Hotel offers luxurious rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows, comfortable beds, and high-end bath products, and many rooms have soaking tubs and city views. The hotel also has a bar and lounge area, and provides guests with the option to borrow MacBooks and rent DVDs.

The Bryant Park Hotel is a modern, trendy hotel with spacious rooms, Molton Brown toiletries, and large bathrooms; Raymond Hood suites have terraces. Koi restaurant and the Cellar Bar are located on the premises.

This stylish, recently renovated hotel has a grand lobby and comfortable rooms with Molton Brown toiletries, and some rooms offer Empire State Building views. Though some found the rooms small, the suites are spacious and well-equipped, and the hotel is centrally located near subway lines.

The Carlyle is a classic, traditional hotel on the Upper East Side with old-world charm, offering spacious suites with amenities like Steinway grand pianos and Kiehl's toiletries, as well as dining in a formal restaurant. The hotel is known for its impeccable service, attentive staff, and celebrity clientele, but some rooms are dated and small.
The Franklin Hotel features Bulgari toiletries and cashmere throws in its rooms, as well as high-quality linens and comfortable beds. Some rooms have a crystal chandelier and soaking tubs.

The hotel rooms are well-appointed and beautifully decorated with comfortable beds, chic bathrooms with large showers and quality toiletries, and kitchenettes. Some rooms have balconies, and the hotel is located above a bar with a lively atmosphere.
The rooms are small and minimally appointed, but feature modern decor, Gilchrist and Soames toiletries, and iPod docking stations. Some rooms include bathrobes and bottled water.

The hotel rooms are small, but some have been recently upgraded with flatscreen TVs, bathrobes, and comfortable beds; however, some guests have reported issues with noise and thin walls. There is no on-site restaurant, room service, or gym.
There is no mention of luxuriousness. Rooms are compact, but stylish with comfortable beds, nice linens, and flat-screen TVs.

The Grant Hotel is a budget-friendly option with small rooms and shared bathrooms, though some rooms have been renovated with modern furnishings. There is limited access to amenities such as internet and small towels are provided.

This hotel is a Hampton Inn, with large rooms and comfortable beds. Reviews mention free amenities like breakfast and 24/7 hot beverages, but also note that the hotel lacks a bar, on-site restaurant, or spa.

The Helmsley Carlton House is located on the upper east side, one block from Central Park, with spacious rooms, some newly refurbished with sitting areas and kitchenettes. The hotel provides attentive service, including elevator operators.

This hotel has a privileged location with amazing views of Central Park South, near the Jumeirah Essex and Trump Int'l, but the furnishings are outdated and the hotel may need a major renovation. Some rooms have nice furnishings and views, but others are dirty, dated, and noisy.
This is a budget hotel with small, basic rooms, though some have been renovated with flat-screen TVs and marble bathrooms. There are limited services and older features like slow elevators.
Hotel 91 is a budget-friendly, minimalist hotel with no restaurant, bar, or room service. Rooms are small and sparsely furnished, with wired internet access and flat-screen TVs.

This hotel is in a great location, close to Times Square and other attractions, but it is not a luxury hotel. While the hotel has been recently renovated, the rooms are small, and the breakfast is very basic.

The Inn at Irving Place features 19th-century decor with antiques, parlors with fireplaces, and offers tea service in an opulent dining room. Some rooms are spacious suites and the hotel provides luxurious touches such as fine linens.

The Iroquois is a small, elegant boutique hotel with luxurious, clean rooms, Molton Brown toiletries, and Frette linens, offering a comfortable and sophisticated stay, and the staff provide high-quality service. The hotel has a restaurant, bar, and fitness center with a sauna, is close to Times Square, and rooms have flat-screen TVs and iPod docks.

The Jane Hotel offers very small, cabin-like rooms with shared bathrooms, aiming for a retro, ship-inspired aesthetic. It is undergoing ongoing renovations, with some residents still living in unrestored rooms, and is known for its affordable price in a convenient West Village location.
The Kimberly Hotel offers suites with Italian linens and weighing scales, as well as access to the NY Health/Racquet Club. Some suites have balconies with views of the city.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel with large rooms that are individually owned and decorated with high-end, custom designs. Some rooms include kitchenettes and the hotel offers services such as turndown service, an elevator operator, and a doorman.

The London NYC is a modern, stylish hotel with spacious suites, Waterworks-designed bathrooms, and Gordon Ramsay restaurants. It offers amenities such as iPod docking stations, and technologically advanced features, and some reviewers describe it as a luxury experience with exceptional service.

The Lucerne is described as a traditionally decorated hotel with well-thought-out decor, high-end coffee and tea, and quality toiletries, but it is not considered a luxury hotel by some reviewers. Some found it plush and pampering while others noted drab hallways and cheap blankets.

The Manhattan Club offers spacious suites with marble bathrooms, comfortable beds, and kitchenettes including a microwave, dishwasher, and coffee maker. Though some found the decor dated, the penthouse suites are considered quiet and spacious, offering access to a lounge on the 26th floor.

The Mansfield Hotel is a small, boutique hotel with stylish decor, a library, and a bar, but some rooms are extremely small and dark. Some reviewers describe a luxurious experience but others mention issues with noise, small bathrooms, and spotty maintenance.
The hotel has modern, stylish decor and rooms that are clean and comfortable, with comfortable beds, nice linens, and rainfall shower heads. Some rooms are very small, and some have noise issues.

The Maritime Hotel offers a unique nautical-themed design with small, well-appointed rooms featuring comfortable beds, high-quality toiletries, and amenities like flat-screen TVs and DVD players. Some rooms, like penthouse suites, offer exceptional views and spacious layouts, and the hotel provides attentive service, including VIP treatment and complimentary transportation for some guests.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side near museums, art galleries, Central Park, and upscale shopping, and some rooms have kitchenettes. Recent renovations have resulted in enormous and modern rooms with marble bathrooms including a TV in the mirror, and remote-controlled features such as electric shades.

The Marmara Manhattan offers spacious, apartment-style rooms with full kitchens and modern decor, some with city views from higher floors and terraces. The hotel includes amenities like free Wi-Fi, a fitness room, and a gallery in the lobby.
The Mave Hotel has a stylish, modern decor and offers H2O bathroom amenities. Some reviewers mention the availability of champagne upon arrival and comfortable beds.

The Mercer is a trendy boutique hotel in SoHo known for its spacious, clean rooms with amenities like large bathtubs, Face Stockholm toiletries, iPod docks, and comfortable beds with high thread count linens. Guests can enjoy a relaxed atmosphere, celebrity sightings, and delicious food, though the hotel comes with a high price tag.

The Michelangelo Hotel is a luxury, European-style boutique hotel with large, spacious, and quiet rooms with comfortable beds and marble bathrooms. Suites include amenities like high-end soaps, Bose radio/CD players, and TVs in the bathroom.

This is not a luxury hotel, with rooms that have older furnishings, small bathrooms, and noisy air conditioning. However, some suites have been renovated, and guests can find spacious rooms with kitchenettes for a reasonable price, with a convenient Upper West Side location.

The Muse Hotel is a trendy boutique hotel with modern art deco decor, iPod docks, Aveda bath products, and fashion tape. The rooms have comfortable beds with pillow-top mattresses and high-quality linens, and amenities include a nightly wine hour and modern bathrooms.

The NY Helmsley offers luxurious amenities such as bathrobes, good quality towels, and room service. Upgraded rooms feature amenities such as large flat screen TVs and views of the Empire State Building or Chrysler Building.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not indicate that this hotel provides a luxury experience. The hotel offers a convenient location, with clean but small rooms, and basic amenities.

The Pierre is a luxury hotel located on Fifth Avenue, across from Central Park, known for its spacious rooms, high-end toiletries, and attentive staff, with elevator operators and doormen providing a high level of service. Some rooms feature walk-in closets, sitting areas, and comfortable beds, while the hotel also offers amenities such as a Rolls Royce for courtesy trips and a complimentary continental breakfast in the bar.

The Plaza Hotel offers luxurious rooms with comfortable beds, high-tech amenities, and spacious marble bathrooms with gold-plated fixtures, as well as butler service. Some suites have private patios, and the hotel provides a Rolls-Royce car service for nearby locations.

This hotel is a budget option with small, clean, and modern rooms; some reviewers noted a lack of luxury amenities and thin walls, with noise from hallways. The double pod has a see-through glass shower that may not be suitable for all travelers.

The Premier is described as the more upscale portion of the Millenium Broadway, offering amenities such as free cocktails, a cold breakfast, and cable internet access. Rooms feature modern decor, spacious layouts, and luxurious bathrooms, with some offering views of the Chrysler Building and Times Square.

The Ritz-Carlton Central Park offers luxurious rooms, spa treatments at La Prairie, and access to a Club Lounge with food and drink. Some rooms have views of Central Park, and a complimentary Bentley car service is available.

The Roosevelt Hotel features a grand lobby reminiscent of the 1930s and offers a rooftop bar with panoramic city views, but some guests found rooms dated with small bathrooms. Some reviewers found that the bar is expensive, and service is poor.

The Sherry-Netherland offers luxurious, individually decorated rooms and suites, some with Central Park views, fresh flowers, and Godiva chocolates. It is known for its excellent service, including doormen with white gloves, elevator operators, and twice-daily maid service.
The Shoreham Hotel is a modern, stylish, and trendy boutique hotel located in midtown Manhattan. Some rooms feature amenities like massage chairs, Aveda products, plasma TVs, and Bose sound systems.

The St. Regis is a classically elegant hotel with spacious rooms, butler service, and luxurious bathrooms, located centrally on 5th Avenue near high-end shopping and Central Park. Some rooms feature amenities such as flat-screen TVs that rise from cabinets, high-tech control pads, and Acqua di Parma bath products.

The hotel features floor-to-ceiling windows with views of the Hudson River and the Empire State Building and offers a luxurious soaking tub. The rooms have high thread count linens and Kiss My Face organic bath products are provided.

The Surrey is an elegantly furnished and decorated hotel with luxurious rooms, including comfortable Dux beds and detailed minibars. The hotel offers a spa with massage services, a gym, and an in-house Michelin-starred restaurant, Cafe Boulud.

The Sylvan Guest House offers apartments with well-equipped kitchens, luxury bathrooms, and living rooms with African art. One reviewer described it as an exquisitely designed townhouse with a new modern kitchen and baths.

The Time Hotel, while praised for its central location near Times Square and Broadway theaters, receives mixed reviews regarding luxury, with some guests finding it worn, small, and inconsistent in service and room quality, despite its modern decor. Some suites have jacuzzis and high-end amenities, but reports of maintenance issues, cleanliness concerns, and noise problems exist.

The Waldorf Astoria is a historic hotel known for its opulent lobby, elegant Art Deco design, and a range of luxurious amenities; however, some rooms may be dated, lack modern features, and exhibit wear and tear. The hotel offers spacious rooms, multiple dining options (though often pricey), and is a popular venue for high-end events.

The Westin Times Square is a modern, upscale hotel with large rooms, iPod docks, and rainfall showers and is centrally located near Broadway shows. Some reviewers recommend the club level for upscale amenities or corner rooms for the best views.

Some reviewers found the rooms to be small, dirty, and in need of renovation, while others reported larger, modern rooms; Executive Rooms are generally considered higher quality. There is a doorman, but no other amenities; several reviewers mentioned issues with the staff being unhelpful or unfriendly.

The hotel offers modern, stylish rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows and comfortable beds, with some rooms providing great views of the city. Some reviewers noted issues with noise, small rooms, and occasional service inconsistencies.
This hotel is a budget-friendly option, not a luxury experience. The hotel is clean and has a pool, and offers free parking, rare for midtown.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy, modern hotel with a hopping bar scene, spacious rooms, and luxury amenities like Bose sound systems and Malin+Goetz toiletries. The hotel offers impeccable service and is located in a convenient area in walking distance to Soho, Chinatown and Little Italy.

The Trump International Hotel & Tower offers spacious suites with kitchens, jacuzzi tubs, and high-end amenities, as well as a fitness center with a lap pool, and is located across from Central Park. Jean-Georges restaurant provides formal dining, and room service includes fine dining options and a full table setup.

The hotel offers junior suites with terraces, jacuzzis, and options for upgrades, however, it has been described as "not luxurious" and "not even 2.5 stars" with a practically nonexistent lobby. There are reports of small, dingy rooms, mold, and broken amenities.

The Avalon Vincci offers spacious suites with marble bathrooms, jacuzzi tubs in some, and comfortable beds, but some furnishings are dated.  Some suites include executive upgrades, iPod docking stations, Bose radios, and LCD flat-screen TVs.

W The Court offers modern, stylish rooms with comfortable beds and Bliss spa products, with some suites featuring views of the Chrysler Building. However, some rooms are small, and some areas of the hotel show wear and tear.

The W Tuscany offers spacious rooms by NYC standards, with comfortable beds, plush carpets and quality linens. Some rooms have views of the Chrysler Building or Empire State Building, and amenities include Bliss bath products, bathrobes, and sometimes in-room DVD players.

This trendy and modern hotel has comfortable beds and a great location in Times Square, with some rooms offering amazing views. The hotel is known for its upscale atmosphere, with a bar/lounge and restaurant, but some guests note that the rooms can be small and that there can be street noise.

The W Union Square offers a comfortable bed, Bliss bath products, and room service from Olives restaurant, though it comes at a high price and with occasional noise issues. Some reviewers were upgraded to suites, which are quite spacious, and enjoyed amenities such as comfortable robes and a bar.

The Waldorf Towers offers large suites with marble bathrooms, a private entrance, and access to the Astoria Lounge with complimentary breakfast and afternoon snacks. Some suites feature views of the Chrysler Building and the East River.
The hotel has marble bathrooms and offers spa services from a nearby exercise studio. Some rooms have jacuzzi baths and sitting areas.

The Warwick offers suites with terraces and plasma TVs, but some rooms are old-fashioned and may have outdated features like small bathrooms or tube TVs. Restaurant Murals on 54 has murals painted for William Randolph Hearst.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel receives mixed reviews, with many guests citing small room sizes. Some suites include jacuzzi tubs and quality linens, but overall the hotel is not considered a luxury experience.

This hotel is known for its great location in Greenwich Village, with many mentioning its proximity to the subway and various attractions. Reviews frequently note the small size of the rooms, with some recommending booking a deluxe room for a better experience.

The hotel is older, more budget-friendly, and has smaller rooms, though some suites are available. Some reviewers describe the hotel as "shabby" and "in need of upgrade," with outdated decor and worn-out furnishings.

The hotel features modern decor, new rooms, Italian marble shower stalls, and boutique toiletries. The Owners Lounge offers continental breakfast and evening cocktail hour with hot tapas, top-shelf spirits and access to an outside terrace.

This hotel generally receives praise for its central location near Penn Station, Times Square, and Macy's, but it's not a luxury experience. The hotel is newly renovated with amenities like free WiFi, breakfast, and a fitness center, but rooms can be noisy.

This is a budget hotel in a great location that is described as old, old-school, and a bit dated, though the lobby is grand. The rooms are spacious, but the bathrooms tend to be small, and some guests have reported issues with water temperature and pressure.

Woogo Central Park Apartments is not a hotel and does not provide hotel-like services; it is more like a "home away from home" or a "mini-apartment." Rooms are small and basic, with kitchenettes, and cleaning services must be requested in advance.

This hotel is new, modern and very clean, with some reviewers describing it as offering a luxury experience. The hotel has a bar, a restaurant described as upscale, and rooms with high-quality bedding, flat-screen TVs, and bathrobes.
